intro: Trichomanes cavifolium, commonly known as the narrow-leaf maidenhair fern, is a species of fern characterized by its delicate, finely divided fronds. It belongs to the family Hymenophyllaceae and is native to tropical and subtropical regions. The plant has small, spore-bearing structures called sorocarps, which are typically found on the undersides of its leaves. Its leaves are usually narrow and have a feathery appearance, with a pale green coloration. Trichomanes cavifolium thrives in moist, shaded environments, often growing on rocks or tree trunks in humid climates.
